google_reviews.author: Storrie Morrow
google_reviews.review: My partner and I have lived here for almost 2 years now, and I couldn't have imagined a better place for us to land. The complex has a lot of amenities. I love the sense of community I've felt here. My neighbors and the staff are so welcoming and quick to fix any issues that have come up. And the location in Bellingham is very convenient.

google_reviews.author: Luke Rose
google_reviews.review: Latisha and her staff were absolutely wonderful the year I lived here. They have strict rules in place which Makes for a wonderful experience both inside and outside of the apartments. They were very attentive to any fixing needs, usually fixing appliances and such within the hour of me calling them. The recently remodeled apartments are absolutely beautiful inside. I would highly Recommend them to anyone looking for a quiet, nicely kept, and well run apartment complex.

google_reviews.author: John Currier
google_reviews.review: I lived here for 5 years after I got divorced.  It was a great home.  The staff was always wonderful to deal with, and 7 years later they're all still there.  The recent remodel looks wonderful and they make a genuine effort to make everyone feel that this is their home.  The opportunity for a large garden is rare for an apartment, and the grounds are amazing.  Walking trails, an old growth apple orchard, etc.

google_reviews.author: Kate Schultehenrich
google_reviews.review: My partner, brother, and I called this complex to gather more information for a 2 bed/1 bath unit as we are planning to move to Washington in the next few months. We were in the process of being put on the wait list when they asked "Will it be a family moving in?" When we explained it would be us three she immediately told us that they wouldn't be able to accept us. We were confused because my partner and I have been living in other apartment units in California together for the past three years and have had no issues regarding us not being a hetero-normative married couple. We further asked why that was an issue and she explained that they've had problems with people breaking leases that made it difficult for the property management. We were trying to explain how discriminatory this sounded while explaining our situation and she said, "Well this isn't the right place for you then" and hung up. I have never had an experience quite as homophobic as this. If possible to give a 0 star I would.

google_reviews.author: Ai Leen
google_reviews.review: The community is okay, amenities are average BUT the manager is RUDE & OBNOXIOUS! She is very condescending, arrogant & really really rude. Walls are thin so be prepared to hear your neighbor snore & other things that happens at night that should be private between couples.

google_reviews.author: Dr Brenda Kotewa
google_reviews.review: The staff here is responsive, friendly, and compassionate. They consider their renters part of their family and plan events accordingly. No discrimination here based on ability, ethnicity, religious beliefs, or gender diversity. Been here five years and no plans to move from this awesome location.

google_reviews.author: Ellie R.
google_reviews.review: The apartment itself is cheaply made and the walls are so thin so you can hear your neighbors even if they are having a normal conversation. The manager and maintenance team are great, though.

yelp_reviews.review: I've only been here a week...I am overwhelmed with the beauty of the interior of my apartment as well as the elegance of the newly remodeled  exterior. The management team is phenomenal! I feel truly fortunate.

summary.text:
Good

Residents of Spring Creek Apartments have expressed appreciation for the community aspect and the amenities provided. Many feel a strong sense of belonging, with one user review highlighting the welcoming nature of both neighbors and staff. Another notable positive is the convenient location in Bellingham, which several residents have found to be ideal for their lifestyles. In terms of living experience, multiple residents praise the complex for being a comfortable landing spot, especially after significant life changes such as a divorce.

The aesthetic appeal of the apartments, particularly after recent renovations, has also been a common thread in user reviews. The opportunity to have a large garden is a rarity that has been celebrated by residents, along with the beautiful grounds which include walking trails and an old growth apple orchard. Such features offer a unique living experience that many tenants have come to treasure during their time at Spring Creek Apartments.

Great

The property management team at Spring Creek Apartments has been lauded for their responsiveness and attentive service. User reviews frequently commend the staff for being friendly and compassionate, often going out of their way to ensure that maintenance issues are addressed promptly, with some reports of appliances being fixed within an hour of being reported. This level of service contributes greatly to the overall positive living experience cited by many tenants.

Apart from the impressive response to maintenance requests, the staff's dedication to creating a family-like atmosphere is also noteworthy. Regularly planned community events appear to make a significant impact on the tenants, fostering a strong sense of community and inclusivity. One reviewer has been so satisfied with the environment and the staff's professionalism that after five years, they have no plans of moving away from what they consider an "awesome location."

Bad

However, not all experiences at Spring Creek Apartments have been positive. There are reviews which speak to issues beyond the property's physical attributes. One such concern is voiced by an individual who encountered what they perceived as homophobic behavior during the leasing process. This incident involved a discouraging interaction with the apartment management, where the potential tenants were unjustly refused accommodation, leading to allegations of discrimination. Such experiences can significantly tarnish the image of the complex and its management.

In addition, there are criticisms regarding the structural integrity of the properties themselves. A review mentioned that the apartments are "cheaply made," with the problem of thin walls being a particular point of contention. The ability to hear neighbors through these thin walls, even during normal conversations, poses a challenge to privacy and can detract from the comfort and enjoyment of residents.

Ugly

The most severe criticism towards Spring Creek Apartments revolves around the behavior of the management, specifically the manager. User reviews describe encounters with the manager as unpleasant due to perceived rudeness and obnoxiousness. This kind of negative interaction can create an unfavorable living environment, overshadowing the positive aspects of the property. When management is described as condescending and arrogant, it raises serious concerns about the tenant-management relationship and the overall well-being of the community.
